newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST-Autoliv Q1 profit seen up 6 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Autoliv Q1 profit seen up 6 pct.

text.p: Swedish car safety equipment manufacturer Autoliv was expected to post a profit after financial items of 319 million crowns for the first quarter of 1997, a Reuters poll of 10 analysts showed on Monday.
In the same period a year ago Autoliv posted a profit after financial items of 300 million crowns.
For the full year 1997 analysts forecast Autoliv would report a profit of 1.31 billion crowns which was 3.5 percent lower than forecasts ahead of the company's 1996 report a few months ago.
Analysts interviewed for the poll were from Aros, Enskilda, Carnegie, Fiba Nordic, Fischer Partners, Kleinwort Benson, Norske Bank, Erik Penser FK, Swedbank, and Ohman.
Autoliv's first quarter result will be released on April 22.
